author: Nate
text: I attempted to edit an order but the design of the text based help failed miserably. I ordered 2 jewelry items late one evening and then found early the next morning that many of my saved items had been reduced in price so I wanted to order 5 additional items to combine with my pending order.  I followed the text help prompts and had two relevant options D) cancel order and E) other.  I selected other which sent me into a black hole canned response mechanism stating that someone would her back to me soon. As the minutes passed and knowing the cancellation window was soon ending, I tried to re-enter the help queue to access the cancel prompt, after which expecting to go about rebuilding my shopping bag hoping to see my canceled items placed back into inventory.  This failed design of a help system would not let me renter the help process on this order, presumably programmed to think that my request had already been satisfied. About 45 min later customer service contacted me about the help request and stated that they could not help me with combining my orders or cancelling the first one since it was already sent to UPS. After many pauses and apparent internal conversations, the rep said all he can do is one time credit 12.95 shipping on the new additional $750 order after I processed it.  That was 1 week ago and I see no credits available in my TRR account.  This seems like such an easy customer service request. TRR needs to take ownership of the poor design and unacceptable service in rectifying it. The system should simply let one return to the help queue to cancel the order or at the very least have indicated that selecting ‘E) other’ would prevent you from ever returning to the queue to cancel the order.  I expect at least $40 credit applied for the duplicate $12.95 shipping and the $28.50 lost sale price on one of the items in the first order as this is how much I’d have saved by simply clicking cancel first order and rebuilding the cart.
title: Real Help customer service needs real help
